name: Chinese Evergreen
summary: Chinese evergreens are popular indoor ornamental plants because they are easy to maintain.

maintenance.comment: These plants don't need much maintenance, just re-pot every two to three years.

watering.comment: Ensure that the soil is always moist, but use slightly less water in the winter.

lighting.comment: Give this plant a good amount of indoor light, but avoid direct sunlight.

environment.comment: The temperature should be between 65 and 80 degrees farenheit. Keep the himidity medium or high, otherwise the leaves will become dry.

image.credit: Forest and Kim Starr - Plants of Hawaii

watering.comment: The Jade plant does not need to be watered on a schedule. Only water it when the top of the soil is dry to the touch.

lighting.comment: Jade plants need direct sunlight to grow properly.

name: Zanzibar Gem
summary: Characterized by their shiny, oval-shaped deep green leaves, ZZ plants make excellent additions to any home or office.

maintenance.comment: ZZ plants are notorious for being low-maintenance, easy-to-care-for houseplants that even gardeners with the blackest of thumbs can keep alive.

watering.comment: Don’t worry too much about forgetting to water your ZZ plant, ZZ plants grow from rhizomes which help them to store water under the soil, making them a ‘drought-tolerant’ plant.

lighting.comment: All they need to thrive is adequate light

environment.comment: The temperature should be between 65 and 75 degrees farenheit. Keep the humidity does not require humid condition but if place in normally dry condition consider a humidifer.

toxicity.comment: Keep out of reach of kids, dogs and cats. indegestion of the leave and or sap can cause upset stomach, diarhea and vomitting

name: Aloe Vera
summary: Renowned for a medicinal ability to heal wounds, they are tough plants that can withstand many different environments

maintenance.comment: Aloe Vera is very low maintence, simply leave your plant in direct sunlight, water it every now and then and you’ll have one healthy aloe vera!

watering.comment: Water about every 3 weeks, to discourage rot, allow the soil to dry at least 1 to 2 inches deep between waterings.

lighting.comment: They love direct sunlight but be catious as to moving one from shade to directly under the sun as it can cause the plant to sunburn.

environment.comment: The temperature should be between 65 and 85 degrees farenheit. KThis plant does not require any extra humidity and can handle dry air.

toxicity.comment: Although considered a medicinal plant for humans, aloe vera's level of toxicity is mild to moderate for cats and dogs.
